Hey everyone. I normally don't post on youtube channels. But all the 
bickering & insults pertaining to Elliot Roger and one's personal diagnosis 
of his mental conditions inspired me to reply. I will try to break this 
down- Elliot Roger was an extreme form of narcissistic personality 
disorder- which at its extremes over time taps into borderline personality 
disorder. His narcissism spanned throughout his own life with extremities 
of emotions from incredible highs to incredible lows- and no in-between's. 
His self-reflection and worth in the World was solely derived upon how 
other's would perceive him.  In most cases with extreme narcissism- 
everything going on around the subject is directed being done for, to or 
against them personally. The World completely revolves around their 
presence only.  Examples are pretty much validated throughout his saga of a 
manifesto he left behind. When a couple was innocently out showing intimacy 
in a public venue- he immediately became volatile and enraged that they 
doing this TO him. When his father made poor financial investments in his 
career- he was doing this TO him. When his mother failed to marry a wealthy 
benefactor for HIS needs she was being selfish and doing this TO him.  If 
someone he was acquainted with had a sexual experience or simply garnered 
the attention of a female this was being done TO and AGAINST him.  Even 
when his younger sibling starting growing taller in height & adapted better 
social skills early on- this was being done yet again- To & AGAINST him. A 
true narcissist feels subjected to all outside actions of other's around 
them as a personally-directed relevance to their own individual gain or 
demise when a healthy mind would never make that unrealistic connection. 
 His grandiosity surged in a feeling of being "owed" everything- from 
winning the lottery in all his failed attempts, having the girls he wanted 
and idealized as "perfect mates" beside other men, etc. He firmly believed 
it was all owed to him and if he did not substantiate by it or receive it 
then the World itself was standing against him- hence his 
self-victimization by it.  He could not fit into any element of a normal 
society due to his distorted and over-absorptive self-importance.  He never 
worked a normal job in his life because anything out there he felt was 
"beneath him". He never kept or made healthy friendships in his adult life 
or had the attention of a girl because in his extreme narcissistic state he 
just expected to sit back and have it all come to him.  All his attempts of 
going out and just sitting in a coffee shop or cafe he expected in his 
tempered self-entitlement and egocentricity would just grace him without 
needing to put in any effort or objective for it himself. With the flawed 
outlook of "Well, my magnificence is here, everyone will notice it & 
inevitably come to me"  As was all his failed conquests & dreams in life- 
He demanded it, expected it but had no clear understanding or desire in 
actually knowing how to work for it or earn it.   And for those that had it 
& what he wanted were the "enemy" and the perpetrators that were robbing it 
from him. This is all normal behaviors seen by someone with NPD. He was not 
a bad looking guy, but when you have a botched outlook, a detached 
personality and narcissistic "everything is owed to me" perspective it just 
drives people away- so he sabotaged all his attempts of keeping or finding 
interpersonal relationships in his life by his psychological ailment that 
fueled such distorted outlooks with other's around him.  Even when very 
attractive people come off as displaced, awkward or maladjusted it tends to 
drive other's away from them and not toward them.  So as the older Elliot 
Roger became- the worse his narcissism grew in his self-regression fringing 
into a borderline-personality disorder.  In BPD- this is where the impulse 
controls & coping mechanisms are completely lost.  This is where the 
emotional instability & already impaired self image really cracked.  And 
this is exactly when he started lashing out by throwing his drinks on 
other's, having public tantrums in restaurants, and going as far as 
stalking & following strangers & attacking them with orange-juice filled 
water-guns. This was the make or break point for him in his state of mental 
health.  If he was not to receive help at that critical point then that 
"threshold" even he talked about in his manifesto would be crossed & never 
returned back from.  There are many behavioral patterns that were 
completely ignored. But that's pretty much his psychopathy in a 
chronological decline over the years. The warning signs were there early 
on.  It was just a shame they were allowed to manifest & grow to the 
extremes they did to ultimately cause that  awful night to happen. Thanks 
for taking the time to read this.  Best wishes..﻿
